documentation.text:
@title FxTokenSale
 @dev FxTokenSale is a base contract for managing a token crowdsale, allowing investors to purchase tokens with ether.

@dev fallback function ***DO NOT OVERRIDE***
 Note that other contracts will transfer funds with a base gas stipend
 of 2300, which is not enough to call buyTokens. Consider calling
 buyTokens directly when purchasing tokens from a contract.

devdoc.details: FxTokenSale is a base contract for managing a token crowdsale, allowing investors to purchase tokens with ether.

buyTokens(address).details: low level token purchase ***DO NOT OVERRIDE*** This function has a non-reentrancy guard, so it shouldn't be called by another `nonReentrant` function.

constructor.details: The rate is the conversion between wei and the smallest and indivisible token unit. So, if you are using a rate of 1e18 with a ERC20Detailed token with 18 decimals called TOK, 1 wei will give you 1 unit, or 1e-18 TOK.

params._rate: Number of token units a buyer gets per MULTIPLIER
params._token: Address of the token being sold
params._treasury: Address where collected funds will be forwarded to

getEstimateToken(uint256).details: Override to extend the way in which ether is converted to tokens.

params.amountIn: Value in wei to be converted into tokens

returns._0: Number of tokens that can be purchased with the specified _amount

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

setRate(uint256).details: The rate is the conversion between wei and the smallest and indivisible token unit. So, if you are using a rate of 1e18 with a ERC20Detailed token with 18 decimals called TOK, 1 wei will give you 1 unit, or 1e-18 TOK.

params._rate: Number of token units a buyer gets per MULTIPLIER

devdoc.title: FxTokenSale
